loan.name: La Nueva Luz (The New Light) Group 1

texts.en:
Jose has a small house in El Seibo and another in the countryside where he raises and milks cows. He currently has 6 cows. Jose sells their milk to local cheese makers. He lives with one son, although he has three in total, ages 21, 24, and 26. Jose is the proud grandfather of a six-year old little boy. Jose has only had a high school education and he really wants his children to be able to continue with their studies and go to college so that they can have professional careers.

Business can be hard because there is no electricity out in the country yet and he has to travel on dirt roads to and from his farm to sell the milk. Jose has successfully repaid 5 loans and is now requesting his 6th. With the loan money, he plans to buy more grain to feed his cows and also to invest it in agriculture on his farm.

Note: This is a group loan for 5 people.

loan.use: To buy more grain to feed his cows and to invest in agriculture on his farm.

loan.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma's efforts have allowed her to get ahead with her own business. She opened her shop in her father's gas station. She remembers that 13 years ago she decided to start her own business in order to make more money and she began by selling juices. Since then, Vilma has not tired. The reason for her hard work are her two small children who are 8 and one. Her goal is to achieve more success with sales of new products. What she sells the most is soda and candy consumed by drivers who have stopped to gas up. She recognizes that in order to attract customers, she has to offer variety. As a result, she wants to start selling lubricants and motor oil. For this reason she is requesting a loan that will be invested in the purchase of these items at wholesale. Please support Vilma in realizing her wish for the wellbeing of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

El esfuerzo de Vilma le ha permitido seguir adelante con su propio negocio, ella abriÃ³ su tienda en el grifo de su padre, recuerda que hace 13 aÃ±os decidiÃ³ emprender un negocio propio para obtener mÃ¡s ingresos y empezÃ³ vendiendo jugos, es asÃ­ que desde ese entonces Vilma no ha descansado, la razÃ³n de su fuerza son sus 2 pequeÃ±os hijos de 8 y un 1aÃ±o. Su meta es poder lograr mayor Ã©xito en sus ventas con nuevos productos, lo que mÃ¡s vende son gaseosas y dulces que consumen los chÃ³feres que se estacionan por combustible, reconoce que para atraer clientes hay que ofrecer variedad, por ello incursionarÃ¡ en la venta de lubricantes y aceite para autos. Por lo cual estÃ¡ solicitando este prÃ©stamo que serÃ¡ invertido en la compra de estos artÃ­culos al por mayor. Apoya a Vilma a concretar su deseo para el bienestar de su familia.

loan.use: Acquire merchandise for her shop and purchase wholesale lubricants and motor oil in order to expand her business.

loan.name: Mariluz

texts.es:
Mariluz is a strong and very courageous woman. She is the mother of five children, of which three are in school and two are still very young. She has been very conscientious of being an important part of the economics of her home. Her business is the sale of water and orange juice, and her point of sale is the main plaza in her area, where each afternoon she offers these juices. She has already been in this business for four years, and it has brought her much satisfaction, but, like a good mother, she doesnâ€™t stop paying attention to her children, and is with them every day in the afternoon. This business is the sustenance of the family, but for progress, there is no rest, so the purpose of the loan Mariluz asks for is to complement her business with the sale of food. She has a very good seasoning and is sure that her dishes will receive a good reception, so she hopes that she can have what sheâ€™s asking for.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva volunteer.

Mariluz es una mujer constante y de mucho coraje, ella es madre de 5 hijos, de los cuales 3 estÃ¡n estudiando y los otros 2 son pequeÃ±itos todavÃ­a. Ella se ha esmerado por ser una aporte muy importante en la economÃ­a de su hogar, su negocio es la venta de agua de maca y jugo de naranja, su punto de venta es en la plaza principal de su localidad, donde todas las tardes ofrece estos jugos. Con este negocio ya tiene 4 aÃ±os y le ha traÃ­do muchas satisfacciones, pero como buena madre, ella no descuida la atenciÃ³n de sus hijos y diariamente por las tardes estÃ¡ con ellos.Este negocio es el sostÃ©n de su familia, pero para el progreso no hay descanso, por ello, el motivo del prÃ©stamo que pide Mariluz es para complementar su negocio con la venta de comida, ella tiene muy buena sazÃ³n y estÃ¡ segura que sus platos tendrÃ¡n buena acogida, asÃ­ como espera que su pedido lo tenga.

loan.use: To buy ingredients to make food to complement her juice sales.

loan.name: Julia

texts.es:
In one of the new developments in the city of Juliaca is located Juliaâ€™s home. Julia decided eight years ago to add a room to her house and start her store. Thanks to the benefit that this business has given her, she has been able to give an education to her two children, to whom she wishes to give the opportunity to continue with their higher education, an opportunity that she never had because of the limited economic resources of her humble parents. The wish of this happy and loving mother is to grow and multiply her stock of products, with the goal of meeting all of the requests of her new neighbors, who take a keen interest in this little store.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva volunteer.

En una de las nuevas urbanizaciones de la ciudad de Juliaca estÃ¡ ubicado el domicilio de Julia, quien desde hace 8 aÃ±os decidiÃ³ adecuar un ambiente de su casa e implementar su bodega, gracias a los beneficios que obtiene con este negocio puede brindarles estudios a sus dos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles la oportunidad de seguir sus estudios superiores, oportunidad que ella nunca tuvo por los bajos recursos econÃ³micos de sus humildes padres.El deseo de esta alegre y amorosa madre es ampliar y aumentar el stock de sus productos con el fin de complacer cada uno de las solicitudes de sus nuevos vecinos quienes encuentran en esta bodeguita una cÃ¡lida atenciÃ³n.

loan.use: Investment capital to buy merchandise for her store.

loan.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha is from San Juan de Loro, in the Sandia province. She first became a mother at a very young age. Since that time she has been buying and selling second-hand clothing, which she buys by packs in the town of Juliaca, and sells in the Rinconada mine, where her husband works.

Currently Bertha lives with her two young children in Juliaca. She wanted to stay at home longer to look after her children, so Bertha took on the business of raising cuyes (guinea pigs.) She would like to buy more cuyes to make her business grow; she is asking for your help to make this happen. With your support, this young woman's project and her children's future will bloom.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva volunteer

Bertha es natural del distrito de San Juan de Loro, provincia de Sandia, tomÃ³ la responsabilidad de ser madre a muy corta edad, desde entonces se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa de segundo uso, mercaderÃ­a que adquiere por fardos en la ciudad de Juliaca y la vende en la mina Rinconada, lugar donde su esposo trabaja obrero. Bertha actualmente vive con sus dos menores hijos en la ciudad de Juliaca. Con el fin de estar mÃ¡s cerca de sus pequeÃ±os y estar al pendiente de sus necesidades decidiÃ³ dedicarse a la crianza de cuyes, negocio con el que desea crecer, Bertha pide tu apoyo desinteresado para aumentar la cantidad de sus animalitos.Apoyemos a esta joven madre a concretar sus proyectos y forjar el futuro de sus hijos.

loan.use: Purchase of cuyes (guinea pigs) to raise and sell

loan.name: Modesta

texts.es:
Despite her advanced age, Modesta continues to be as enterprising and diligent as ever. She enjoys the satisfaction of having provided education and financial stability for her two children, who are about to start college with high hopes and a sense of responsibility. Modesta and her husband Gregorio, a master mason, were able to build their small home. Modesta also raises chickens and cuyes (guinea pigs), and sells them in the town of Juliacaâ€™s weekend market. Modesta also keeps a small stand outside her house porch, where she sells candy. She would like to purchase more candy to stock up her stand. Modesta is hoping for a favorable answer from your caring heart.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva volunteer

Pese a su avanzada edad, doÃ±a Modesta, sigue con su espÃ­ritu emprendedor y diligente que siempre la caracterizÃ³, gracias a ello, actualmente tiene la satisfacciÃ³n de brindarle estabilidad econÃ³mica y educaciÃ³n a sus 2 menores hijos, quienes dentro de poco tiempo concluirÃ¡n sus estudios secundarios para emprender con mucha ilusiÃ³n y responsabilidad sus estudios universitarios.Junto a su esposo Gregorio, quien trabaja como maestro albaÃ±il lograron construir su pequeÃ±a vivienda, lugar donde tambiÃ©n cobija y alimenta a sus animalitos menores (gallinas y cuyes) y los vende cuando estos ya toman un peso y talla adecuada en la feria de la plaza dominical de la ciudad de Juliaca. Adicionalmente a esta labor DoÃ±a Modesta tiene un pequeÃ±o puesto de venta de golosinas en el frontis de su casa, negocio en el que pretende aumentar el stock de mercaderÃ­a para ello espera recibir respuesta favorable de cada uno de vuestros corazones solidarios.

loan.use: Purchase of merchandise to stock up candy stand

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 25, 2008)

loan.name: TeÃ³fila

texts.es:
Creativity and ability in the visual arts are Teofilaâ€™s natural talents. She and her husband work on t-shirt screen printing, design and printing of cards and mementos for all occasions. This young couple partnered with a few of their relatives to open an offset and screen printing shop. Their creativity, hard work, and finely finished products have earned them many satisfied clients in Juliacan, who in turn have recommended their services to other people in town. Teofila is requesting a loan for 1000 soles to purchase a wider variety of paints.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva volunteer

La creatividad y habilidad en las artes visuales son la especialidad de Teofila, junto a su esposo se dedican a realizar trabajos de impresiÃ³n de serigrafÃ­a en camisetas, estampado de recuerdos y diseÃ±os de tarjetas para diferentes ocasiones.Esta joven pareja, en sociedad con algunos familiares lograron abrir un taller de impresiÃ³n en offset y serigrafÃ­a, donde con mucha creatividad, ofrecen sus servicios a la poblaciÃ³n juliaqueÃ±a, quienes se quedan satisfechos por el arte y acabado, haciendo que estos mismos clientes recomienden el trabajo ha otras personas.El deseo de Teofila es adquirir un prÃ©stamo por el monto de 1000 soles, dinero que tiene proyectado invertir en adquirir variedad de pintura, con ese propÃ³sito es su peticiÃ³n.

loan.use: Purchase of wider variety of paint for screen printing business

loan.name: Ebenezer Group

texts.en:
Eucaris A. (pictured on the far left) is a 26-year-old woman who lives with her husband and two children (ages 6 and 8) in a small community called Villa Ortega in the eastern province of Hato Mayor in the Dominican Republic. She began a small business selling shoes and continues to increase her inventory with each loan. Currently, Eucaris walks through the streets selling her shoes in addition to selling them from her home. Eucaris works hard to grow her business so that she can provide her children with a good education. She also hopes to save enough money in order to go to nursing school one day.

Eucaris is the leader of the 5-person micro-bank group, Ebenezer. Each of these unique Dominican entrepreneurs unite in solidarity, allowing them to access funding that they would otherwise never be able to receive on their own.

On behalf of Eucaris, the Ebenezer group, and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

loan.use: To buy more shoes

loan.name: Apostol Santiago Group

texts.en:
The community of Puca Cruz belongs to the Rosario District, province of Acombamba, department of Huancavelica. Puca Cruz is approximately 3800 meters (12,500 ft) above sea level, a community that is economically based principally on raising cattle and sheep, agriculture (mostly barley, wheat, oats and potatoes) and in some cases commercial cattle-raising in the fairs in the district capitals (Acombamba and PaucarÃ¡). Puca Cruz is situated between PaucarÃ¡ and Acobamba and being the necessary pathway between the two cities, most of the people are engaged in trade activities.

Primitiva S. T. is a member of the village bank with a loan of 600 Peruvian Nuevo Soles ($210 USD). She says: "My business is to buy and sell livestock such as sheep, cows and pigs that I bring to PaucarÃ¡ and the Acombamba fair. Furthermore I raise animals and cultivate oats, barley and potatoes in order to make 'chuÃ±o' (dried potato). In a few years I hope to allow my children to study and become professionals. Now they are in Huancayo studying in high school. With FINCA PerÃº I am going to save for my childrenÂ´s future because I want to make them study and not only work on a farm. I also hope to increase my livestock. Now I am with FINCA PerÃº in order to learn how to save and work with more confidence, responsibility and to receive the training that they are going to give." MarÃ­a G. P. is working with a loan of 600 Peruvian Nuevo Soles ($210 USD) and says the following: "I and my spouse work to buy and sell animals, principally cattle. I myself have a business where I buy and sell sheep and at times cattle. My dream is to enable my children to study in Huancayo or the Institute of PaucarÃ¡. I have joined FINCA PerÃº to learn how to save because I have a relative that has joined a village bank and has told me it has been a very good experience. I am going to listen to FINCAÂ´s training and at times celebrate the birthdays of fellow members and learn to practice human values."

loan.use: Commercial livestock raising

loan.name: Ofelia

texts.es:
For three years, Ofelia has sold catalog cosmetics. At the same time, she sells ceviche every weekend outside the home. Nevertheless, she has been forced to stop selling due to her poor health. Ofelia also sells clothing when she receives orders. Her neighbors and her family members are her customers. The loans that she has requested are to purchase a mototaxi for her son so he may work. Ofelia would like to start a bar or clothing shop in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Ofelia vende cosmÃ©ticos por catÃ¡logo desde hace 3 aÃ±os. Asimismo, ella vende cebiche todos los fines de semana afuera de su casa. Sin embargo, ha tenido que dejar de vender porque estÃ¡ delicada de salud. Ofelia tambiÃ©n vende ropa por pedidos. Sus vecinos y familiares son sus clientes. Los prÃ©stamos que ha pedido le han servido para comprar una mototaxi y dÃ¡rsela a su hijo para que trabaje. A Ofelia le gustarÃ­a poner un bar en su casa o una tienda de ropa.

loan.use: To purchase a mototaxi to give to her son so he may work.

loan.name: Miriam

texts.es:
For 8 years, Miriam has sold food outside of the market in her neighborhood. She was motivated to do this because her mother-in-law and sisters-in-law also worked in this business. She works from 9 a.m. until 1:30 p.m. Previously, she also used to sell food at night outside her house, but she had to stop to be able to care for her children. The loans that she has requested have helped her repair her food cart and purchase a canopy to cover it. Miriam has purchased a piece of land together with other merchants. They want to build a market. She would like to fulfill her goal of having her own food stand.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Desde hace 8 aÃ±os, Miriam vende comida afuera del mercado que estÃ¡ en su barrio. Ella se animÃ³ a raÃ­z de que su suegra y sus cuÃ±adas tambiÃ©n se dedicaban a ese negocio. Ella trabaja desde las 9 de la maÃ±ana hasta la 1.30 de la tarde. Antes tambiÃ©n vendÃ­a comida en la noche afuera de su casa, pero tuvo que dejarlo para poder cuidar a sus hijos. Los prÃ©stamos que ha pedido le han servido para arreglar su carreta de comida y comprarse un toldo cubridor. Miriam ha comprado un terreno junto con otros comerciantes. Ellos quieren construir un mercado. A ella le gustarÃ­a poder concretar su meta teniendo un puesto de comida propio.

loan.use: To repair her food cart and to purchase a canopy to cover it.

loan.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesus has sold breakfast meals from a cart for 20 years. She sells in the market near her house from 7:30 in the morning until mid-day. The loan that she's requested has been used to pay household expenses and the costs of the ingredients she needs for the meals she sells.

Jesus would like to be able to improve her cart because it's falling apart.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

JesÃºs vende desayunos en su carreta desde hace 20 aÃ±os. Ella vende en el mercado que estÃ¡ cerca de su casa desde las 7.30 de la maÃ±ana hasta el mediodÃ­a. Los prÃ©stamos que ha pedido le han servido para cubrir los gastos de la casa y para los ingredientes de los desayunos que ofrece.

A JesÃºs le gustarÃ­a poder mejorar su carreta ya que estÃ¡ deteriorada.

loan.use: Household costs and ingredients for food business.

loan.name: WiÃ±aypaq QuÃ±ukusun Group

texts.en:
The community of Calzada belongs to the district of Rosario, province of Acombamba, department of Huancavelica. Calzada is approximately 3800 meters (12,500 ft) above sea level, a community economically based on raising livestock (cattle, sheep), agriculture (barley, wheat, oats, potatoes) and in some cases traD. activities in the fairs in the district capitals (Acobamba and PaucarÃ¡). The population is sparse and it usually takes five minutes to get from house to house.

Village bank member Julia A. S. has a loan of 1000 Peruvian Nuevo Soles ($355 USD) and according to her testimony she says: "I have a business to buy and sell livestock and I bring them to the Acobamba and PaucarÃ¡ fairs and in order to sell I need to leave at two in the morning and reach the fairs. In a few years I hope to have enough animals in order to raise and sell them when I need to. Furthermore I have a grandchild that is with me and studies at Puca Cruz. In the future I hope that he studies to become a professional after he finishes high school. In FINCA PerÃº I am saving for the future of my grandchild because he is the only one by my siD.. Also I want to increase my livestock. Now that I am with FINCA PerÃº, I have learned to save and work with more confidence, more responsibility and also to attend the training sessions."

Guillerma P. P. is working with a loan of 600 Peruvian Nuevo Soles ($213 USD) and says the following: " I have a business to buy and sell livestock, principally sheep and at times cattle. When I see that an animal is fat I am able to sell it in the fair. My dream is to have much more livestock, to be able to raise and sell more of them in the future. I am going to save for my childrenÂ´s education. Now that I have joined FINCA PerÃº I am going to learn how to save, because I have neighbors and relatives that have joined FINCA PerÃº and they tell me it is very nice to belong to a village bank. I will listen to the organizationÂ´s training, share with the other clients, work with more responsibility and acquire some items that we need. I will receive training that FINCA has promised and I am going to learn many valuable things that I want for my family and myself."

loan.use: Commercial livestock raising (cattle, sheep)

loan.name: Creolinda

texts.es:
Creolinda used to work on a farm, but she had to stop because she had her daughter. This is how she decided to start a store in her house five years ago. She offers basic goods such as groceries and liquor. But Creolinda also is dedicated to music. She has sung in a folk group for five years. She has shows every weekend, both in Lima and in other provinces. The loans she has requested have helped her purchase the merchandise that she offers in her store. She would like to be able to expand her store.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Creolinda trabajaba en una avÃ­cola, pero tuvo que darlo debido a que tuvo su hija. Fue asÃ­ que decidiÃ³ poner una bodega en su casa hace 5 aÃ±os. Ella ofrece productos de primera necesidad, abarrotes y licores. Pero Creolinda tambiÃ©n se dedica a la mÃºsica. Ella canta en un grupo folclÃ³rico desde hace 5 aÃ±os. Todos los fines de semana tiene presentaciones, tanto en Lima como en provincias. Los prÃ©stamos que ha pedido le han servido para comprar la mercaderÃ­a que ofrece en su bodega. A ella le gustarÃ­a poder ampliar su bodega.

loan.use: To purchase a better assortment of merchandise for her store.

loan.name: Zenayda

texts.es:
Zenayda has made a living selling and distributing clothes for 4 months. She had worked selling food for 9 years before, but she had to wrap up that business to care for her children. She now sells clothes on order to her neighbors and friends. The business allows her to spend more time with her children.

The loans that Zenayda has applied for have been used to buy the clothes she sells. She would like to have a space of her own for selling her clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Zenayda se dedica a la venta y reparto de ropa desde hace 4 meses. Ella se ha dedicado por 9 aÃ±os a la venta de comida, sin embargo tuvo que dejar este negocio debido a que tenÃ­a que cuidar a sus hijos. Ahora se encarga de vender ropa por pedidos a sus vecinos y amigos. De este modo, comparte mÃ¡s tiempo con sus hijos.

Los prÃ©stamos que ha solicitado le han servido para comprar la ropa que ofrece. A ella le gustarÃ­a tener un puesto y vender su ropa allÃ­.

loan.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loan.name: Mery

texts.es:
Mery has worked selling and delivering chickens for the past 4 years. Every day she receives a delivery of around 200 live chickens to her home. She is in charge of killing them in the small poultry area of her house. Her husband then sells them from the stall they have in the market. They also make deliveries around the area. Her husband was the one who first had the idea for the business because he had previously worked on a poultry farm. Mery also has a mototaxi that she rents out daily. The loan that she is requesting will help her pay in advance for the chickens. She would like one day to have a piece of land where she could build a poultry farm.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Desde hace 4 aÃ±os, Mery se dedica a la venta y reparto de pollo. Ella todos los dÃ­as recibe en su casa alrededor de 200 pollos vivos. Ella se encarga de matarlos en su pequeÃ±a avÃ­cola instalada en su casa. Luego su esposo los vende en el puesto que ambos tienen en el mercado. TambiÃ©n hace repartos por la zona. Fue su esposo quiÃ©n tuvo la idea de este negocio, puesto que Ã©l antes trabajaba en una avÃ­cola. Mery tambiÃ©n tiene una mototaxi la cual la alquila diariamente. Los prÃ©stamos que ha pedido le servirÃ¡n para pagar por adelantado los pollos. A ella le gustarÃ­a tener un terreno y poder construir su avÃ­cola.

loan.use: Pay in advance for the chickens she sells

loan.name: Noemi

texts.es:
NoemÃ­ used to be a domestic employee, but she left this job and decided to start a store in her home. For 4 years, she has sold various products such as basic goods, groceries, clothing, and decorations. NoemÃ­ also likes to cook. For 10 years, she has cooked at events or parties where they hire her. She has used the loans she has requested to buy more of the merchandise that her business needs. She would like to expand her store and to start a clothing store in the middle of the city.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

NoemÃ­ era empleada domÃ©stica, pero luego dejÃ³ esta actividad y decidiÃ³ poner una bodega-bazar en su casa. Es asÃ­ que desde hace 4 aÃ±os, ella vende diversos productos, entre artÃ­culos de primera necesidad, abarrotes, ropa y adornos. Asimismo, a NoemÃ­ le gusta cocinar, por lo que desde hace 10 aÃ±os ella se dedica a cocinar en eventos o fiestas donde la contratan. Los prÃ©stamos que ha solicitado los ha utilizado para aumentar la mercaderÃ­a que su negocio necesita. A ella le gustarÃ­a agrandar mÃ¡s su bodega-bazar y poner una tienda de ropa en el centro de la ciudad.

loan.use: To buy more of the merchandise that her business needs

loan.name: Edith

texts.es:
Someone suggested a year ago that Edith sign up to be a beauty consultant and she agreed. That's how she came to sell cosmetics, bought from catalogs, to her friends and acquaintances. She also works for a collection agency now and then.

The loans that she's requested have been used to pay advances on the cosmetics that she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

A Edith le propusieron inscribirse como consultora de belleza hace 1 aÃ±o y ella aceptÃ³. Es asÃ­ que ella ofrece sus cosmÃ©ticos por medio de catÃ¡logos a sus amistades. Asimismo, ella trabaja esporÃ¡dicamente en una empresa de cobranzas.

Los prÃ©stamos que ha pedido le han servido para el capital que necesita para pagar por adelantado los cosmÃ©ticos que ofrece.

loan.use: Advance payment on merchandise for resale.

loan.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel Ãngel was selling gas canisters from his home, however, this business wasnâ€™t profitable and he had to evaluate his other options. This was how he decided to buy a mototaxi and work with that 6 months ago. He still has his gas canister business, but his mother is in charge of running it. The loans that he has received have helped him pay for his membership in the mototaxi consortium in his neighborhood. Miguel Ãngel would like his brother to become a member and to work delivering chickens.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Miguel Ãngel se dedicaba a la venta de balones de gas en su casa, sin embargo, este negocio no le resultÃ³ rentable, por lo que tuvo que evaluar otras opciones. Fue asÃ­ que hace 6 meses decidiÃ³ comprarse una mototaxi y trabajar en eso. Ã‰l aÃºn mantiene el negocio de los balones de gas, pero es su mamÃ¡ quiÃ©n se encarga de administrarlo. Los prÃ©stamos que ha recibido le han servido para pagar la inscripciÃ³n en el consorcio de mototaxistas de su zona. A Miguel Ãngel le gustarÃ­a hacerse socio de su hermano y trabajar en el reparto de pollos.

loan.use: Pay for membership in the neighborhood mototaxi consortium

loan.name: Anselma

texts.es:
For 4 years, Anselma has earned a living renting washing machines. A friend encouraged her to set up the business. She's been slowly adding washers and she now has 4 of them. She rents them to her neighbors by the hour. Her children help her move the washers to the houses of her customers. For 3 years, Anselma has also sold gas in cylinders from her house. Her neighbors know her now and she has a large set of customers. Her children help her to deliver the cylinders.

The loans that she's requested have been used to maintain her washing machines and to buy the fourth machine. Anselma would like to have a space in her house to store the gas cylinders that she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Anselma se dedica al alquiler de lavadoras desde hace 4 aÃ±os. Fue una amiga quien le animÃ³ a poner este negocio. Es asÃ­ que fue comprando poco a poco estas mÃ¡quinas y en la actualidad cuenta con 4 lavadoras. Ellas las alquila a sus vecinos por horas. Sus hijos la ayudan a trasladar las lavadoras a las casas de sus clientes. Asimismo, desde hace 3 aÃ±os Anselma se dedica a la venta de balones de gas en su casa. Sus vecinos ya la conocen, por lo que tiene una vasta clientela. Sus hijos la ayudan repartiendo los balones a domicilio.

Los prÃ©stamos que ha pedido le han servido para el mantenimiento de las mÃ¡quinas y para comprar la cuarta lavadora. Anselma quisiera tener un espacio amplio en su casa y guardar allÃ­ los balones de gas que ofrece.

loan.use: Buy and maintain washing machines for washer-rental business.

loan.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila has rented out rooms and apartments for 15 years. She used to live with her mother, but met her current partner and decided to buy a house. She began renting her garage, and then she built rooms and two apartments in her home in order to rent them out. Currently, Lucila keeps constructing rooms.

Lucila has worked selling clothes to order for 9 years, as well. She keeps working in this business and sells clothing to her neighbors.

The loan that she is requesting will help her buy accessories and furnishings for the bathroom in one of her rental rooms. She would like to continue building more apartments in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Lucila se dedica al alquiler de cuartos y departamentos desde hace 15 aÃ±os. Ella antes vivÃ­a con su mamÃ¡, pero conociÃ³ a su actual pareja y decidiÃ³ comprarse una casa. Ella empezÃ³ alquilando su cochera, luego construyÃ³ cuartos y dos departamentos en su casa para alquilarlos. En la actualidad, Lucila sigue construyendo cuartos.

Pero, Lucila se dedica a la venta de ropa por pedidos desde que tiene 9 aÃ±os. Ella sigue en este negocio y ofrece ropa a sus vecinos.

Los prÃ©stamos que ha solicitado le servirÃ¡ para los accesorios y arreglos del baÃ±o de uno de los cuartos que alquila. A ella le gustarÃ­a seguir construyendo mÃ¡s departamentos en su casa.

loan.use: Purchase accessories and furnishings for the bathrooms in one of her rental rooms

loan.name: Valle Verde Group

texts.en:
The community of Rocchacc is located in the district of Anco, province of Churcampa, which is in the department of Huancavelica. Rocchacc is approximately 2100 meters (6890 ft) above sea level, a town economically based on agriculture of fruits and vegetables and in some cases the raising of livestock. The population has a medium level of commercial activity because Rocchacc is a passing point between Ayacucho and Huancayo.

The client Josefina M. T. is going to work with a loan of 200 Peruvian Nuevo Soles ($70 USD) and according to her testimony she states, "I have a small store where I sell groceries and other small things such as sweets; I do not have animals yet to graze, for now I only have my business and my fruit farm for chirimoya (native fruit) that I sell in the Larcay fair. In a few years I would like to leave Rocchacc and buy a house in Huancayo where business is good. Furthermore, I hope that my children study to become professionals after they are done with high school. In FINCA PerÃº I am going to save for my childrenÂ´s future and for their education and also to develop my small store in the short-term. Now that I have joined FINCA PerÃº I am going to learn how to save, receive training, and the organization's values of working with more courage and responsibility."

The client Carmen T. V. is going to work with a loan of 200 Peruvian Nuevo Soles ($70 USD) and says the following: "I have a guinea pig and fruit farm and some cattle to sell when I need to. My dream is that my children study and are able to become professionals in the future. I am going to save for their education. Now that I have rejoined FINCA PerÃº I am going to save more because I have previously belonged to a village bank and I really like the training that the organization gave me. Furthermore I am going to work with more responsibility and save with more confidence because for the first time I have participated in an institution where they have returned my savings without any problems."

loan.use: Grow fruits and vegetables; raise livestock

loan.name: Heidens

texts.es:
Heidens worked at a garage and that is how he learned the trade. Therefore, seven years ago he decided to establish his own garage at his house. Moreover, Heidens also has a taxi which he lets on a daily basis.

He has used the loans he has received so far to buy material and tools. Now, he would like to expand his garage and buy more tools.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Heidens trabajaba como asistente en un taller de mecÃ¡nica, por lo que aprendiÃ³ este oficio. Fue asÃ­ que hace 7 aÃ±os decidiÃ³ independizarse y abrir su propio taller de planchado de autos en su casa.

Igualmente, Heidens tiene un carro que lo alquila diariamente como taxi. Los prÃ©stamos que ha solicitado le han servido para comprar sus materiales y herramientas de mecÃ¡nica. A Ã©l le gustarÃ­a ampliar su taller y comprar mÃ¡s herramientas.

loan.use: To expand his garage and buy more tools

loan.name: Macedonia

texts.es:
Macedonia has been dedicated to weaving sweaters for 18 years. She learned to weave and bought a weaving machine. She has a small workshop in her home, where she has weaving and sewing machines. During the day, she weaves a sweater. She also makes clothing that her neighbors and friends order from her. The loans she has requested have helped her buy work tools and supplies. She would like to purchase another weaving machine and to expand her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Macedonia se dedica al tejido de chompas desde hace 18 aÃ±os. Ella aprendiÃ³ a tejer y se comprÃ³ una mÃ¡quina tejedora. Ella tiene un pequeÃ±o taller instalado en su casa, donde cuenta con mÃ¡quinas tejedoras y de costura. Al dÃ­a, Macedonia teje una chompa. Asimismo, ella tambiÃ©n confecciona ropa que sus vecinos y amistades le encargan. Los prÃ©stamos que ha solicitado le han servido para comprar sus herramientas y materiales de trabajo. A ella le gustarÃ­a comprarse otra mÃ¡quina de tejer y ampliar su taller.

loan.use: To purchase work tools and supplies.

loan.name: Catalicia

texts.es:
Catalicia sells fruits and meats in a small market near her house. Six years ago, she formed a group of people who wanted to set up businesses and together they rented a large space to sell their products. That's how they started a mini-market. Catalicia has worked in daycare centers and communal eateries. She's always been a leader wherever she's worked.

The loans that Catalicia has applied for have been used to expand her business and to open a stall in another mini-market where her husband works. She would like to find other people to open more mini-markets in other places.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Catalicia vende frutas y carne en un pequeÃ±o mercado cerca de su casa. Hace 6 aÃ±os, ella formÃ³ un grupo de personas que querÃ­an poner un negocio, por lo que entre todos alquilaron un local grande y empezaron a vender sus productos. Fue asÃ­ que formaron un mini mercado. Catalicia ha trabajado cuidando niÃ±os en guarderÃ­as comunales y en comedores populares. Siempre ha sido lidereza de estas organizaciones.

Los prÃ©stamos que ha pedido le han servido para ampliar su negocio y para abrir un puesto en otro mini-mercado. AllÃ­ trabaja su esposo. Catalicia quisiera contar con mÃ¡s gente para abrir mÃ¡s minis-mercados en otros lugares.

loan.use: To expand food business and open another stall.

loan.name: Remegia

texts.es:
Remegia is a cheerful 24-year-old woman who shows a great diligent spirit despite financial hardship; everyday she takes to the streets selling fuel, and tries to advance this business. Renegia also raises and sells chickens and cuyes (guinea pigs). She started this business about 2 months ago, and since then she has bought more than 140 chickens, which will be sold after they gain enough weight. She is also planning on selling the eggs produced by some of the chickens. This latter business is turning out good profits for Remegia, and now she would like to build a chicken coop to protect the animals, as well as increase her investment capital for her fuel sale business.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva volunteer

Remegia es una alegre mujer de 24 aÃ±os, pese a sus bajos recursos econÃ³micos muestra un inmenso espÃ­ritu diligente y dÃ­a a dÃ­a busca salir adelante con su negocio de venta de combustible en forma ambulatoria, paralelamente compra y vende animales menores (gallinas y cuyes), iniciÃ³ con este negocio hace aproximadamente 2 meses en ese tiempo logrÃ³ tener mÃ¡s de 140 gallinas que luego de alimentarlas y engordarlas para que tomen un peso y tamaÃ±o adecuado las vende, tambiÃ©n tiene planeado destinarlas a la producciÃ³n de huevos para comercializarlos. Este negocio de compra y venta de animales menores le esta resultando rentable, ahora requiere comprar materiales para la construcciÃ³n de una granja y asÃ­ mantener a sus animales en protecciÃ³n, adicionalmente Remegia tiene en mente aumentar su capital de inversiÃ³n en su negocio de combustible.

loan.use: Purchase of construction materials for chicken coop

loan.name: Flor

texts.es:
Since four years, Flor sells food outside of the market. Before, she used to help another women but she decided to establish her own business. Therefore, Flor leaves her home in a small cart every morning to sell food from 9am to 13.30pm.

Flor requests a loan to buy cooking utensils as cutlery and pots. Flor would like to increase her sales by also selling cracklings.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Flor vende comida afuera del mercado desde hace 4 aÃ±os. Antes ella ayudaba a otra seÃ±ora en este tipo de ventas, fue asÃ­ que decidiÃ³ poner su propio negocio. Flor sale a vender todos los dÃ­as en su carreta desde las 9 de la maÃ±ana hasta la 1.30 de la tarde.

Los prÃ©stamos que ha pedido le han servido para comprar sus utensilios de cocina como cubiertos y ollas. A Flor le gustarÃ­a ampliar sus ventas y ofrecer chicharrones.

loan.use: To buy cooking utensils as cutlery and pots

loan.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca is a very cheerful woman. Her parents used to trade cattle so she bacame involved in this business at a very early age; these days trading sheep is one of her familyâ€™s indispensable sources of income. Francisca has another business activity: she makes beautiful gold chains, crafted with patience and skill, joining piece by piece until a beautiful work is finished. Thanks to her business ventures, her dear daughters grew with financial stability, and they have always been of great help. Francisca would like to have capital to invest in her sheep trade business and make enough profits to install basic services in her home. Francisca waits for your kind answer.

Translated by Maria B., Kiva volunteer

Francisca es una mujer muy alegre, desde pequeÃ±a siempre estuvo ligada a la compra y venta de ganado, actividad que heredÃ³ de sus padres quienes fueron sus mejores maestros, ahora hizo de esta actividad uno de sus indispensables ingresos familiares. DoÃ±a Francisca se dedica a dos negocios: a la compra y venta de ganado ovino y a la artesanÃ­a, elaboraciÃ³n de hermosas cadenas de oro que con paciencia y habilidad une pieza por pieza con los materiales que le proveen para sus bellas obras. Gracias a los ingresos que obtiene con estas actividades, pudo brindarles seguridad a sus dos queridas hijas quienes en todo momento la apoyan en su labor. El deseo de Francisca es contar con mayor capital de inversiÃ³n en su negocio de compra y venta de ganado, con el propÃ³sito de obtener mejores ingresos para por fin hacer instalar los servicios bÃ¡sicos de su domicilio, puesto que eso fue postergando por falta de recursos econÃ³micos. Francisca se encuentra en expectativa de tu respuesta.

loan.use: Investment capital for sheep trade business.

loan.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana is a cheerful woman. Her natural talent for knitting has made her an excellent artisan, and this craft provides most of her income. Ana has an excellent reason to push forward and not give up: her little daughter Anabel. Currently, both live with Anaâ€™s motherâ€™s, who encourages her and helps with Anabelâ€™s care and education. This young mother would like to purchase more wool yarn to make sweaters and skirts. Hard-working Ana is certain that with your help she will be able to continue weaving her and her daughterâ€™s dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva volunteer

Ana es una mujer alegre y hÃ¡bil para el trabajo textil, su predisposiciÃ³n para esta labor la convirtiÃ³ en una excelente tejedora haciendo de este oficio su principal ingreso econÃ³mico, Ana tiene una razÃ³n por quien velar y seguir adelante, su pequeÃ±a niÃ±a Anabel, quien es razÃ³n suficiente para persistir.Actualmente vive en casa de su madre, quien la apoya y orienta en la educaciÃ³n de su niÃ±a, esta joven madre tiene en mente adquirir materia prima (lana) para seguir tejiendo sus hermosas enaguas y chompas, esta diligente dama estÃ¡ segura que con tu colaboraciÃ³n podrÃ¡ seguir tejiendo sus sueÃ±os y la de su amada niÃ±a.

loan.use: Purchase of materials (wool yarn) to knit clothing

loan.name: Felicinda

texts.es:
For 40 years, Felicinda has sold snack foods from her cart. She goes out every day to sell on an avenue near her house. Her work day stretches past midnight. Felicinda used to work as a fruit vendor and as a cleaner, cleaning public gardens and streets. She had to quit those jobs for health reasons.

The loans that Felicinda has applied for have been used to buy the merchandise that she sells. She would like to go back to working as an office cleaner.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Felicinda vende golosinas en su carreta desde hace 40 aÃ±os. Ella todas las tardes sale a vender en la avenida cerca de su casa. Su jornada termina pasada la medianoche. Felicinda ha trabajado vendiendo frutas y haciendo limpieza pÃºblica en jardines y calles. Tuvo que dejar esta actividad por motivos de salud.

Los prÃ©stamos que ha pedido le han servido para comprar la mercaderÃ­a que ofrece. A ella le gustarÃ­a volver a trabajar haciendo limpieza en oficinas.

loan.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loan.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana had worked as a street vendor for several years. She sold breakfast and lunch. However, she then decided to sell fresh fish in a mini-market near her house. She also sells fried fish in the afternoon to the public. She works from 9 a.m. until 11 p.m. The loans she has requested have helped her cover the expenses of her business. Juana would like to expand her sales with more and better merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Juana ha trabajado como vendedora ambulante por varios aÃ±os. Luego vendiÃ³ desayunos y comida. Sin embargo, luego decidiÃ³ vender pescado fresco en un mini-mercado cerca de su casa. Asimismo, por la tarde ella ofrece pescado frito al pÃºblico. Trabaja desde las 9 de la maÃ±ana hasta las 11 de la noche. Los prÃ©stamos que ha pedido le han servido para cubrir los gastos de su negocio. A Juana le gustarÃ­a ampliar sus ventas con mayor y mejor mercaderÃ­a.

loan.use: To cover the expenses of her business.

loan.name: Martha

texts.es:
The district of Chucuito is located on the shores of lake Titicaca. This is where Martha was born. She left her town with many expectations of improving her quality of life and that of her family. She presently lives in the city of Juliaca, where she makes a living thanks to her husband's dedication and her noble textile work. She skillfully and creatively makes beautiful and distinctive garments for women and children. Martha currently has a weaving shop where she employs two other young people who also make elegant designs, making a perfect combination with the variety of colors that they have. Right now their work is generating a lot of demand, which is why they need to acquire different types of wool to continue weaving.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

A las orillas del lago Titicaca estÃ¡ ubicado el distrito de Chucuito, donde naciÃ³ Martha, quien saliÃ³ de su pueblo con mucha expectativa de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Actualmente radica en la ciudad de Juliaca, lugar donde viene construyendo su vivienda gracias al esfuerzo de su esposo y a su noble labor textil. HÃ¡bil y creativamente elabora hermosas y distintivas prendas de vestir para damas y niÃ±os; Martha actualmente tiene un taller de tejidos donde ofrece trabajo a otros dos jÃ³venes quienes al igual que ella realizan elegantes diseÃ±os, haciendo una combinaciÃ³n perfecta con la variedad de colores con los que cuentan; en estos momentos sus trabajos estÃ¡n logrando alcanzar gran demanda, por ello requiere adquirir diferentes tipos de lana para continuar tejiendo.

loan.use: Purchase of a variety of wool to weave her garments.

loan.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es:
Maria Rosa used to sell at the market but things didnâ€™t go well. Therefore, four years ago she decided to establish a shop inside her house.

Maria Rosa had worked at a sewing workshop and she also does embroideries, according to the season. p> With the loan she will receive, she would like to buy more products to expand her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

MarÃ­a Rosa vendÃ­a en el mercado, pero no le fue bien, por lo que hace 4 aÃ±os decidiÃ³ poner una bodega en su casa.

MarÃ­a Rosa ha trabajado en un taller de costura, por lo que tambiÃ©n se dedica a bordar, dependiendo la temporada. Los prÃ©stamos que ha pedido le han servido A ella le gustarÃ­a ampliar su tienda.

loan.use: To buy more products to expand her shop

loan.name: Haydee

texts.es:
Haydee has worked selling cosmetics, bought from a catalog, for 4 years. She also makes sequined emboidery for a nearby workshop. Haydee makes the embroidery at home and pays local women to help her. In addition to those two businesses, Haydee has a garage at her house where she rents space for 5 cars.

The loans that Haydee has requested have been used to pay her helpers at the embroidery business. She would like to buy a display case for her cosmetics. She also hopes to have her own embroidery workshop one day.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Haydee se dedica a la venta de cosmÃ©ticos por catÃ¡logo desde hace 4 aÃ±os. Igualmente, ella hace bordados de lentejuela que un taller le encarga. Haydee los hace en su casa y, eventualmente, le paga a otras vecinas para que la ayuden en los bordados. Haydee tiene una cochera en su casa, por lo que desde hace 3 aÃ±os, lo alquila guardando 5 autos.

Los prÃ©stamos que ha pedido los ha utilizado para pagar a sus ayudantes bordadoras. Haydee quisiera comprarse una vitrina exhibidora donde colocar sus cosmÃ©ticos. Asimismo, a ella le gustarÃ­a tener su propio taller de bordado.

loan.use: To pay assistants for embroidery business.

loan.name: Maribel

texts.es:
For 10 years, Maribel and her sister have made a living selling pastries. She's responsible for making the pastries and distributing them to bakeries, markets and schools. She's been in poor health recently and has had to leave the business in the hands of her sister. She hopes to recover soon and return to the business. In the meantime, she's been selling clothes to order.

The loans that she's applied for have been used to buy wholesale supplies of the ingredients that she needs to make her pastries. Maribel would like to have her own bakery and leave a person there to sell. She wants to continue delivering the pastries and finding new customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Desde hace 10 aÃ±os, Maribel se dedica a la venta de pasteles junto con su hermana. Ella se encarga de preparar los pasteles y repartirlos a panaderÃ­as, mercados y colegios. Sin embargo, Maribel se encuentra delicada de salud, por lo que ha dejado el negocio en manos de su hermana. Espera recuperarse pronto y volver a su negocio. TambiÃ©n ha vendido ropa por pedidos.

Los prÃ©stamos que ha solicitado le han servido para comprar por mayor los ingredientes que necesita para hacer sus pasteles. Maribel quisiera tener su propia panaderÃ­a y dejar una persona encargada de las ventas. Ella desea seguir repartiendo pasteles y buscar nuevos clientes.

loan.use: Buy ingredients for bakery business.

loan.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys and her husband formed their household with many dreams of offering love, unity and above all tranquility to their dear children. This is why they decided to work in seasonal sales, meaning that they acquire products according to the season or time of year that meet the needs of people and sell them at an affordable price. They buy wholesale in the cities of Desaguadero and Tacna, selling their items in the cities of Juliaca, Ilave and Ayaviri during fairs in the different village surrounding their city. In the cold season Gladyn also sells hats, clothing, and personal accessories and wishes to acquire bedspreads, sheets and blankets. It is for this purpose that she is requesting support with the hope of finding a helping hand among all of you.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer.

Gladys y su esposo formaron su hogar con muchas ilusiones de ofrecerles amor, uniÃ³n y sobre todo tranquilidad a sus queridos hijos, por ello decidieron dedicarse al negocio de las ventas, pero por temporada, es decir, segÃºn la estaciÃ³n o Ã©poca del aÃ±o ellos adquieren productos acorde a las necesidades de la gente y los venden a precios cÃ³modos. Ellos comprar al por mayor en las ciudades de Desaguadero y Tacna, comercializando sus artÃ­culos en las ciudades de Juliaca, Ilave y Ayaviri durante las ferias de los distintos pueblitos aledaÃ±os a su ciudad. Gladys, por temporada de friÃ³, adicionalmente de vender sombreros, prendas de vestir, accesorios personales desea adquirir colchas, sÃ¡banas y mantas. Por ese propÃ³sito va su peticiÃ³n con la esperanza de encontrar en ustedes una mano ayuda.

loan.use: Investment capital for the purchase of merchandise for her business.

loan.name: Rina

texts.es:
Rina and TomÃ¡s are married and are very hardworking people. They have supported their household with effort and dedication with the only objective of providing them with love, tranquility and a good education to their 10 children, who are now responsible adults due to the good example that they received from their parents. TomÃ¡s works as a professor in an educational center in the city of Huancane while his wife, with the support of their children, works weaving beautiful and elegant sweaters as only Rina weaves with her agile and creative hands. Her items are avidly sold in the San JosÃ© market in the city of Juliaca. The wish of this diligent mother is to have the funds to acquire another sewing machine to be able to increase the volume of production of her pretty sweaters.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer.

Rina y TomÃ¡s son esposos y personas muy trabajadoras, todo este tiempo han mantenido su hogar con esfuerzo y dedicaciÃ³n, con el Ãºnico objetivo de brindar amor, tranquilidad y buena educaciÃ³n a sus 10 queridos hijos, quienes ahora demuestran ser hombres de bien por el buen ejemplo que recibieron de sus padres. TomÃ¡s trabaja como profesor en un centro educativo de la ciudad de Huancane, en tanto su esposa con apoyo de sus hijos estÃ¡ dedicada al tejido de hermosas y elegantes chompas como solo doÃ±a Rina con sus Ã¡giles y creativas manos teje, sus prendas son vendidas avivadamente en el mercado San JosÃ© de la ciudad de Juliaca, el deseo de esta diligente madre es contar con presupuesto para adquirir otra mÃ¡quina de tejer y de esa manera aumentar el volumen de producciÃ³n de sus bonitas chompas.

loan.use: To buy another sewing machine for her textile business.

loan.name: Clara

texts.es:
The economic possibilities of her family did not allow her to continue her primary education. Clara is 40 years old and for many years she has worked producing handicrafts. In addition to this work, she is investing with great expectations in a hen production business. This small but indispensable business is allowing her to live tranquilly and with the hope of improving her income. Claraâ€™s dedicated mother is in charge of caring for and feeding their little animals so that they in a short period of time are able to reproduce and, in some cases, can provide them with eggs to sell wholesale. Claraâ€™s wish is to acquire a greater quantity of hens to continue raising and then selling them.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer.

Las posibilidades econÃ³micas de su familia no le permitieron seguir su educaciÃ³n bÃ¡sica, doÃ±a Clara de 40 aÃ±os durante muchos aÃ±os se viene dedicando a la artesanÃ­a, adicionalmente a esta labor con mucha expectativa estÃ¡ incursionando en el negocio de producciÃ³n de gallinas, este pequeÃ±o, pero indispensable negocio le estÃ¡ permitiendo vivir con tranquilidad y la esperanza de mejorar sus ingresos. La madre de Clara es quien con suma dedicaciÃ³n se encarga de cuidar y alimentar a sus animalitos, para que estos en muy corto tiempo logren reproducirse y en algunos casos puedan proveerles de huevos para comercializarlos al por mayor. El deseo de Clara es adquirir mayor cantidad de gallinas, para continuar con su crianza y venta posterior.

loan.use: To buy more hens to raise and re-sell.

loan.name: Jhon

texts.es:
Jhon was excited about finishing a university career but his economic possibilities postponed this project. He currently works trading electronic appliances, merchandise which he brings from the city of Tacna and the neighboring country of Bolivia and sells in the Riconada mine with a significant profit margin. Thanks to the benefits that he receives he can contribute to the household expenses of his small house and in this way he compensates his dear mother for the love, education and good example that she always gave him. To continue with this business he requires an investment and he sees the need for a loan, money which he promises to pay back in the period mentioned.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer.

Jhon tenÃ­a muchas ilusiones de concluir una carrera universitaria pero sus posibilidades econÃ³micas postergaron este proyecto, actualmente se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de artefactos elÃ©ctricos, mercaderÃ­a que trae de la ciudad de Tacna y del vecino paÃ­s de Bolivia ofreciÃ©ndolos en la mina Rinconada con un significativo margen de ganancia, gracias a los beneficios que obtiene puede colaborar con los gastos de la canasta familiar de su hogar y la refacciÃ³n de su pequeÃ±a casa, de esta manera compensar a su querida madre por el amor, educaciÃ³n y buen ejemplo que en todo momento le brindÃ³. Para continuar con este negocio requiere de una inversiÃ³n, por ello, se ve en la necesidad de solicitar gentilmente un prÃ©stamo, dinero que promete rembolsar en el plazo mencionado.

loan.use: Investment capital for his appliance business

loan.name: Isidora

texts.es:
Isidora, for most of her life, followed the same line of work as her mother, making delicious food dishes. Her business was located in the Rinconada mine, where it's very cold and far from the city. And so, in order to enjoy the company of her young daughter and spend more time with her, this hard working mother decided to set up a farmyard to rear chickens from home in the city. And so she invested her hard-earned capital, but she stills needs additional funds to purchase certain materials and more chickens, which is why she is looking for financial assistance.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Isidora a lo largo de estos aÃ±os puso en practica el oficio que heredÃ³ de su querida madre, la preparaciÃ³n de deliciosos platos, este negocio lo tenÃ­a ubicado en la mina Rinconada, un lugar muy frÃ­o y alejado de la ciudad. Pero con el fin de gozar de la compaÃ±Ã­a de su pequeÃ±a niÃ±a y estar mÃ¡s unida a ella esta diligente madre decidiÃ³ implementar un espacioso corral de crianzas de gallinas en su casa en la ciudad, para ello invirtiÃ³ el capital que durante estos aÃ±os le costÃ³ reunir, pero para algunos materiales y mÃ¡s gallinas le falta cierta cantidad de dinero, que solicita en prÃ©stamo ante ustedes.

loan.use: To buy chickens and materials to set up a farmyard.

loan.name: Melody

texts.es:
Melody and her husband have 2 children, now of school age, and like all parents they want their children to achieve more than they have. Thatâ€™s not to say that they have not achieved anything, both continue to work hard. This couple own 2 tuk-tuks (three wheeled vehicles) which they use to transport passengers. One is driven by CÃ©sar, Melodyâ€™s husband, and the other by a driver who they contract. At the same time, Melody has a clothing business, which she hopes to rent a premises for, as she currently is keeping all the stock in her house and selling it to her neighbors and friends, going door to door. Melody is requesting this loan to pay for maintenance on her tuk-tuks so that they continue to function well, and also to buy different stock for her clothing business so that she can diversify and increase sales.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Melody y su esposo tienen 2 hijos que aÃºn estÃ¡n en la escuela, como todo padre, ellos desean que sus hijos puedan surgir mÃ¡s de lo que ellos lo hicieron hasta hoy, pero eso no significa que su avance haya menguado, ya que siguen trabajando duramente por su propia superaciÃ³n. Esta pareja es propietaria de 2 motocarros, lo que usan para el transporte de pasajeros, uno de ellos es manejado por CÃ©sar, esposo de Melody y el otro por un chofer que ellos contratan para esa labor. Paralelamente Melody tiene un negocio de ropa, en el cual espera alquilar un local para ello, ya que por el momento tiene la mercaderÃ­a en su casa y la va ofreciendo a sus vecinos y amigos de puerta en puerta.El motivo del pedido de prÃ©stamo de Melody es para pagar el mantenimiento de sus motocarros para que tengan un mejor desempeÃ±o, y por otro lado para la compra de variedad de ropa para incrementar sus ventas.

loan.use: To maintain her tuk-tuks and buy stock for her clothing business

loan.name: ElÃ­as

texts.es:
ElÃ­as is 55 years old and has two sons. Following his separation from his wife, he currently lives by himself. This, however, has not stopped him being a father. Despite the fact that his children are now grown ups, he continues to offer them his love and support. ElÃ­as sells corn and beans at the Bellavista market in his area. The loan he is requesting would enable him to buy more stock and sell not only in his local area, but in other areas of Peru. ElÃ­as has a difficult task ahead of him, but itâ€™s not impossible. With your help, he can take one step further towards his dream

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

ElÃ­as tiene 55 aÃ±os y 2 hijos, actualmente vive solo, debido a que se separÃ³ de su esposa, si embargo esto no mellÃ³ en su responsabilidad como padre y a pesar que sus hijos ya son independientes Ã©l no duda en ofrecerles su apoyo y amor.ElÃ­as se dedica a la venta de maÃ­z y frÃ©jol, en el mercado Bellavista de su localidad. El prÃ©stamo que Ã©l pide es para aumentar su mercaderÃ­a y poder vender no sÃ³lo en su departamento, sino tambiÃ©n enviarlo a otras zonas del PerÃº. ElÃ­as tiene una meta difÃ­cil, pero no imposible, contamos que tu ayuda sea uno de los pasos para el progreso de ElÃ­as.

loan.use: Increase capital for his grain business

loan.name: Cadith

texts.es:
Three years ago Cadith lost her husband. He was her companion and her support, and she misses him very much. Her three children and she cried the loss of her husband and father, and it has been hard to accept the death of a man so full of vitality, but they have. Cadith knew that the only way to keep him in their lives was to not give in to depression and work to get ahead, since that would be what he would have wanted her to do, and she did. She owns a food business. She is an expert cook, and she sells dinner plates with cold drinks, since it is always very hot in her town. She is requesting a loan which she will use to build a stand where she can sell her delicious dishes and that way provide more comfort for her clients and herself.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Hace 3 aÃ±os Cadith perdiÃ³ a su esposo, pena difÃ­cil de superar, ya que ella lo amaba mucho, y era su compaÃ±ero de camino, y soporte. Tanto ella como sus 3 hijos lloraron la partida de su padre con mucho dolor, es difÃ­cil aceptar la muerte de un hombre lleno de vitalidad, pero asÃ­ fue y lo aceptaron.Cadith sabÃ­a que la Ãºnica manera de tenerlo presente, era no dejarse llevar por la depresiÃ³n y seguir adelante, eso es lo que Ã©l quisiera ver en ella, y asÃ­ lo ha hecho hasta hoy.Su negocio, es la comida, es una experta cocinera, vende platos de comida por las noches acompaÃ±ados de heladas bebidas, ya que su localidad tiene un clima muy caluroso.Ella recurre a este medio para solicitar un prÃ©stamo el cual utilizarÃ¡ para la construcciÃ³n de un kiosko para la venta de sus deliciosos platos, y tener mayor comodidad, tanto para ella como para sus clientes.

loan.use: To expand her business by building a kiosk.

loan.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
Luis Enrique is a 38 year old father of one. He is single, and his son lives with his mother in Lima. He makes and sells charcoal, and most of his earnings go to support his son so that he can complete his university studies (like every father Luis Enrique dreams with the possibility of his son completing his university studies, and he knows that college is not cheap). Charcoal making is an activity that can be inconvenient for most people that live around the area, and with a reason. In order to avoid problems and arguments with his neighbors, Luis Enrique wants to rent his own space for his business (where he can make charcoal and attend his customers), and that is the reason why he is asking for a loan so that he can afford these expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Luis Enrique es un padre de 38 aÃ±os de edad, el no estÃ¡ casado, por lo que vive separado de su hijo de 8 aÃ±os que vive con su mamÃ¡ en la ciudad de Lima. Su trabajo consiste en la elaboraciÃ³n y venta de carbÃ³n, de cuyas ganancias separa el mayor porcentaje para enviarlo a Lima para los gastos de su hijo, que como todo padre sueÃ±a con que pueda completar estudios universitarios, y Ã©l sabe que la universidad no es barata.La fabricaciÃ³n de carbÃ³n puede resultar molesta para las personas que viven en las zonas aledaÃ±as a donde se fabrica, y con razÃ³n.Por ello, para no tener problemas y discusiones con sus vecinos, Luis Enrique quiere alquilar un local apropiado para la fabricaciÃ³n del carbÃ³n y para la atenciÃ³n de sus clientes, y para ello recurre a ustedes, solicitando un prÃ©stamo que pueda ayudar a solventar estos gastos.

loan.use: To rent an appropriate place for the making and selling of charcoal.

loan.name: Erick

texts.es:
Erick is 32 years old. He has a beautiful talent--dance. He is a teacher of traditional dances and for that reason, together with his wife Loti, decided to start a business to rent dresses for the different regional dances. He has clients, a part from the general public, at different educational institutions that rent his dresses for their different activities. Demand has increased and that has been very beneficial for Erick, but it is not enough. Because of this, he wishes to buy more dresses and rent a location where he could have his garments on display for a better selection and the convenience of his clients. Because of this, he turns to you in search of a friendly hand that will help him to raise up his business economically.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva.org volunteer.

Erick tiene 32 aÃ±os, Ã©l tiene un hermoso talento, el baile, es profesor de danzas tÃ­picas, y por ello junto a su esposa Loti decidieron poner un negocio de alquiler de trajes para las diferentes danzas regionales. Tiene como clientes, a parte de todo pÃºblico, a diferentes instituciones educativas que le alquilan sus trajes para sus diversas actividades. La demanda ha subido y eso es muy beneficioso para Erick, pero ya no se da abasto, por ello desea comprar mÃ¡s trajes y alquilar un local donde pueda tener sus prendas en exhibiciÃ³n para una mejor acogida y comodidad de sus clientes, por ello recurre que ustedes en busca de una mano amiga que le ayude econÃ³micamente a levantar su negocio.

loan.use: To acquire traditional dresses and rent them out from his business location

loan.name: Carla

texts.es:
Carla is a young, 23 year old mother. She has a beautiful little girl that is her reason for working, to provide her with the necessities and save for her university studies. She works in selling personal products (safety pins , shampoo, hair removers, razors, etc). in a stall in the market of her town. She turns to you all for an economic loan to increase her merchandise and increase her business. Carla's youth is a testament to the effort that she makes to give her daughter a good start and for her own personal improvement. She is waiting for your help and thanks you ahead of time for your response.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva.org volunteer.

Carla es una joven madre de 23 aÃ±os, tiene una pequeÃ±a y hermosa niÃ±a que es su razÃ³n de trabajo, suplir sus necesidades y ahorrar para sus estudios universitarios. Ella se dedica a la venta de pasamanerÃ­a (ganchos, shampoo, depiladores, afeitadores, etc.) en un puesto del mercado de su localidad.Ella recurre a ustedes por un prÃ©stamo econÃ³mico para el incremento de mercaderÃ­a y mejora de su negocio. La juventud de Carla es testigo del esfuerzo que hace para sacar adelante a su hija y a ella misma en su superaciÃ³n personal. Espera su apoyo agradeciendo de ante mano su respuesta.

loan.use: Investment capital for the improvement and growth of a business.

loan.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
The F. family requests a loan of $525 in order to finish building up their house. They bought the land and started building one part of the house with their own savings. They will use their savings and Kivaâ€™s loan to finish the construction.

The five members of the family (mother, father, and three children) are looking forward to living in a more spacious home. Their third son was born this year and they want to complete the finishes on their new house as soon as possible. Mr F. works as an operator at a boilers factory, and will use this income to pay back the Kiva loan. (He was not able to be present for the photograph because he was at work.)

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

La familia F. esta solicitando un prÃ©stamo a Kiva de $525 para terminar la construcciÃ³n de su casa. Ellos ya compraron un terreno ya construyeron la primera parte de la casa con sus propios ahorros. Van a disponer del prÃ©stamo de Kiva junto con sus propios ahorros para terminar los acabados de la casa. Su tercer hijo naciÃ³ en este aÃ±o y quieren cambiarse a su nueva casa lo mÃ¡s pronto posible. El Sr. F. trabaja como operario en una fabrica de elaboraciÃ³n de boilers.

loan.use: To finish building up their house

loan.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophea K., 21, and her husband, Mr. Saran Chheang, 24, live on an Island of MeK. River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2004 and have two sons.

Mrs. Sophea has been a silk weaver since she was sixteen years old, a skill she learned from her mother, while Mr. Saran has been a silk weaver since he was married. The couple sells their finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh.

Sophea is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loan.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loan.name: Sithouk

texts.en:
Mrs. Sithouk P., 40, and her husband, Mr. Kimhok Va, 42, live on an Island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1990 and have four children, two sons and two daughters. Three of her children are in the local school and the first daughter sells desserts at home.

Mrs. Sithouk has been a silk weaver for seventeen years, a skill she learned from her neighbor, while Mr. Kimhok is a mason and assists his wife to weave silk at home when he is free from his construction work. Sithouk sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh.

Now she is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loan.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loan.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophy S. (shown in the picture in the right with her sister) is single and lives with her elder parent and other three sisters along National Road Number One, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. One of her sisters weaves cotton scarves at home, the other sister works in Phnom Penh, and the youngest one is in school.

Mrs. Sophy has been a cotton scarf weaver since 1980, a skill she learned from her parents. She sells her finished products to a wholesaler in Phnom Penh. She is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase a motorcycle for her sister to drive to work in Phnom Penh.

loan.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her sister drive to work.

loan.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Mrs. Phalla N., 41, and her husband, Mr. Vit Sou, live along National Road Number One about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1987 and have seven children; four sons and three daughters. Five of them are in the local school. One daughter is a garment factory worker and the youngest one stays at home.

Mrs. Phalla has been selling fruits for three years. She buys them from farmers in her village and near-by villagers for resale at Phnom Penh suburban market. Mr. Vit is a mason in the village.

Phalla is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase fruits on contract before harvesting for the future season.

loan.use: To purchase fruit in contract for the future season for resale.

loan.name: Lim

texts.en:
Mrs. Lim P., age 37, is widow who lives in a small village off of National Road Two, about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She has two sons and one daughter. All of them attend the local school.
Mrs. Lim P. has been selling fish for eighteen years. She buys the fish from a nearby district market and resells them at market in Phnom Penh. Now she is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more fish to expand her business.

loan.use: To purchase fish for resale.

loan.name: Sarin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarin I, age 33, is a widow who lives along National Road Number Five, about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She has four children, two sons and two daughters. All of them attend the local school.
Mrs. Sarin has been selling lotus flowers for ten years. She buys them from her village and resells them at market in Phnom Penh. Now she is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase lotus flowers on contract to expand her business.

loan.use: To purchase lotus flowers on contract to resell

loan.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Mr. Sorn C., 64, and his wife, Mrs. Thoeun Non, 47, live along National Road Number Five, about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, Cambodia. They were married in 1993 and have three children, two sons and one daughter. Two of them attend the local school.
Mr. Sorn has been farming and working as a hairdresser since he was young. He grows rice in the village, while his wife sells fruit in front of a factory. Now he is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase rice seed and to pay the fee for plowing his rice plot.

loan.use: To pay the fee for plowing and to buy rice seed.

loan.name: Shahin

texts.en: Shahin H. was born in 1954. He is married and has 3 children. Mr. H. is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan-Kalbadjar, and he has settled in Khirdalan town. Fifteen years ago he started his business of making and selling mouldings. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy the supplies that are necessary for making the mouldings.

loan.use: To buy supplies for making mouldings

loan.name: Sevindj

texts.en: Sevindj A. is the mother of 3 children. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan-Zangilan, and she has settled in the Absheron region. Six years ago she started her general store. Now she needs a loan of $1200 to buy food to improve her business. Sevindj was born in 1967.

loan.use: To buy food

loan.name: Elina

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 20-year-old Elina Bengela. She is married and has no children.

In 2005, Elina established her grocery business. Working seven days a week, and 15 hours a day, she earns about US $60 every month from this business. She is assisted by her husband.

Elina requires a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of rice, beans and vegetables in bulk.. In the future, Elina plans to change the business. She thanks you for your support.

The Swahili word for this type of outside shop, or stall, is "genge." A genge is usually a very basic structure made of wood, with a tin roof, which sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chili, oil, rice and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people send their children running to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal, and donâ€™t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.

loan.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice, beans and vegetables in bulk.

loan.name: Zuwena

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 24-year-old Zuwena S.. She is married and has two children ages 2 and 6.

In 2006, Zuwena established her grocery business. Zuwena requires a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of rice, beans and vegetables in bulk. In the future, Zuwena plans to to open another business. She thanks you for your support.

The Swahili word for this type of outside shop, or stall, is "genge." A genge is usually a very basic structure made of wood, with a tin roof, which sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chili, oil, rice and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people send their children running to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal, and donâ€™t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.

loan.use: To purchase additional stock of beans, rice and vegetables in bulk.

loan.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 50-year-old Hilda M.. She is married and has three children with ages between 20 and 26.

In 2005, Hilda established her pharmacy business. Hilda has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional medicine. In the future, Hilda plans to to increase the quantity and range of the stock.. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment â€“ a process called a sale-and-leaseback arrangement.

loan.use: To purchase medicine.

loan.name: Albertine

texts.fr:
Born January 15, 1980 in Agblangandan in OuÃ©mÃ© County in the southwest of Benin, Mrs. Albertine Adjike is married and the mother of two children, Roberto (10) and in 5th grade and RaÃ¯ssa (6) in 2nd grade. She is specialized in the sale of underclothes and women's and children's clothing which she buys in Lome, Togo. Finding herself presently faced with economic difficulties, she is asking for her third loan in the amount of 200,000 francs (US$ 500) so as to respond to the ever increasing demands of her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

NÃ©e le 15 janvier 1980 Ã  Agblangandan dans le DÃ©partement de l'OuÃ©mÃ© au Sud-ouest du BÃ©nin, dame ADJIKE Albertine est mariÃ©e et mÃ¨re de deux enfants Roberto Ã¢gÃ© de 10 ans en classe de CM II et RaÃ¯ssa Ã¢gÃ©e de 6 ans en classe de CP II. Elle est spÃ©cialiÃ©e dans la distribution des sous vÃªtements, des habits de femmes et d'enfants qu'elle achÃ¨te Ã  LomÃ© au Togo. Face aux difficultÃ©s financiÃ¨res actuelles, elle sollicite pour son troisiÃ¨me crÃ©dit une somme de 200 000 francs afin de rÃ©pondre aux demandes sans cesse croissante de sa clientÃ¨le.

Purchase of 10 dozen women's underwear and 15 dozen children's garments

Achat de 10 douzaines de sous vÃªtement pour femme et de 15 douzaines d'habits d'enfants

loan.name: CathÃ©rine

texts.fr:
Mrs. CathÃ©rine H. was born around 1973 in Porto-Novo, the political capital of Benin. Married to a cook by the name of Blaise Boko, she is the mother of two children: Romuald (13) and Bermine (11). Mrs. H. retails various items such as milk, sugar, soap, and biscuits in the biggest open-air market of Benin, Dantokpa. Her niece, Valerie (14), who is not enrolled in school, often helps out with the business.

Currently experiencing some difficulty with stocking her shop, Mrs. H. is asking for this loan in order to satisfy the demand of her clientele and raise her familyâ€™s standard of living.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Dame H. CathÃ©rine est nÃ©e vers les annÃ©es1973 Ã  Porto-Novo dans la capitale politique du BENIN. MariÃ©e Ã  un cuisinier du nom de BOKO Blaise, elle est mÃ¨re de 02 enfants: Romuald et Bermine Ã¢gÃ©s respectivement de 13 ans et de 11 ans. Elle est souvent aidÃ©e dans son activitÃ© par sa niÃ¨ce Valerie Ã¢gÃ©e de 14 ans et non scolarisÃ©e. Elle est une revendeuse de divers articles tels que le lait, le sucre, le savon et les biscuits dans le plus grand marchÃ© du BENIN Dantokpa.

Eprouvant actuellement des difficultÃ©s pour s'approvisionner, elle sollicite alors ce crÃ©dit afin de satisfaire Ã  la demande de sa clientÃ¨le et d'augmenter le niveau de vie de sa famille.

loan.use:
Purchase of 3 cases of sugar, 3 cases of soap, 2 cases of biscuits, 2 cases of concentrated milk, and 2 cases of evaporated milk

Achat de 03 cartons de sucres, de 03 cartons de savons, de 02 cartons de biscuits, de 02 cartons de lait concentrÃ© sucrÃ© et de 02 cartons de lait concentrÃ© non sucrÃ©.
